thread.title: Dolphins' Grimes says he's not distracted by wife's arrest
thread.title_full: Dolphins' Grimes says he's not distracted by wife's arrest

title: Dolphins' Grimes says he's not distracted by wife's arrest
text:
Updated: 2:57 p.m. Wednesday, Sept. 30, 2015 | Posted: 2:57 p.m. Wednesday, Sept. 30, 2015 Dolphins' Grimes says he's not distracted by wife's arrest Related View Larger This photo made available by the Miami-Dade Department of Corrections, shows Miko Grimes, wife of Miami Dolphins player Brent Grimes under arrest, Sunday, Sept. 27, 2015. Grimes faces charges of disorderly conduct, battery on a police officer and resisting arrest with violence. Grimes was arrested after the Miami Dolphins game against the Buffalo Bills. (Miami-Dade Department of Corrections via AP) View Larger Buffalo Bills wide receiver Percy Harvin (18) runs the ball between Miami Dolphins strong safety Reshad Jones (20) and cornerback Brent Grimes (21) during the first half of an NFL football game, Sunday, Sept. 27, 2015, in Miami Gardens, Fla. Miko Grimes, the wife of Grimes, was arrested Sunday in the parking lot of Sunlife Stadium before the game. Miko Grimes is facing charges that include disorderly conduct, battery on a police officer and resisting arrest with violence. No details were given about what led to the arrest. (AP Photo/Wilfredo Lee) View Larger CORRECTS TO ARRESTED BEFORE, NOT AFTER THE GAME - This photo made available by the Miami-Dade Department of Corrections, shows Miko Grimes, wife of Miami Dolphins player Brent Grimes under arrest, Sunday, Sept. 27, 2015. Grimes faces charges of disorderly conduct, battery on a police officer and resisting arrest with violence. Grimes was arrested before the Miami Dolphins game against the Buffalo Bills. (Miami-Dade Department of Corrections via AP) Sponsored Links The Associated Press DAVIE, Fla. â€” 
Miami Dolphins cornerback Brent Grimes says he's concentrating on football in the wake of his wife's arrest outside the stadium before the team's most recent game. 
Miko Grimes is scheduled for arraignment Oct. 27 on charges of disorderly conduct, battery on a police officer and resisting arrest with violence. She was arrested Sunday while walking in the stadium parking lot, and police say she disobeyed an officer's command to stop, became combative and head-butted an officer. 
"Miko is fine," Grimes said Wednesday, talking publicly about the incident for the first time. "I really don't want to talk about Miko. That will handle itself." 
When asked if the matter was a distraction for him, Grimes said no. 
"I'm good. Stuff will happen, but you have to focus on your job," he said. 
The Dolphins will try to bounce back from a 41-14 loss to Buffalo when they play Sunday against the Jets in London.
